title: An idea for a tenacity rework.
body:
What if instead of reducing the duration of a cc, It instead changed a duration of that cc into a weaker cc.

So like instead of having 25% tenacity, you would have like .5 tenacity

And then whenever you got hit by a stun, instead of being stunned immediatly it would be a 20% slow for the first .5 seconds, and if the stun lasts longer than that then the stun would then apply its remaining duration to you.

Lets say you have 1.5 tenacity and morg snares you for 3 seconds

First 1.5 seconds after being hit would be a slow,
after that you would be snared for the remaining 1.5 seconds.

Knockbacks still not affected.

replies.body: I think that would have extreme gameplay clarity issues.

with the new system for cc it would probably not.

Just have the first bit come up as TENACITY and have the visual affects from whatever spell still apply.

No, the problem lies in the spells' descriptions.

For example, Annie's passive states that after X casts the next spell will STUN.  The person tries it, and on some champs it does indeed stun, but on others it slows?  The person will then be like "wtf????"

It's much like the old {{item:3140}} tuning situation with {{champion:238}} and {{champion:114}} .

It makes game knowledge more useful.

Besides who reads tooltips. are tooltips even useful at all.

Can't tell if you're trolling or not :/

Champions are balanced around their kit's intended interactions.
All I'll add is that the tenacity system in your OP makes it very hard (if not impossible) to balance any champion with CC in their kit.

Honestly I don't think league should be a balanced game anymore. more specifically I don't think its possible with already existing mechanics such as pen and lifesteal. Instead focus should be given to more hate mechanics, and to create better environments for non top tier champions without changing any statistic.

I respectfully disagree.

While pen and lifesteal sometimes have tuning issues, nobody really scratches their head when they interact with them.

League's respect for gameplay clarity is what drove me to play this game in particular over other Mobas.

Curious what you mean by more focus on hate mechanics.  Are you saying they should address them more quickly or make more?

>to create better environments for non top tier champions without changing any statistic.

I think their shift to more small gameplay updates means they are trying to fix this one champ at a time.

I dont know about you but when I dive a carry at low hp it is pretty confusing when I look at my combo and see that I overkill them 500 points of damage, and then don't actually get the kill because of the enemies lifesteal.

We already know if they have lifesteal though, and it's delayed.
We know they will heal _at least some of the damage_ due to the lifesteal if they are allowed to do so.  It's part of counterplay and can be reduced using {{item:3123}} .
It doesn't change your entire combo the same way as cc type changing would.
All of these things apply to my version of tenacity, save gw. should also be noted that my version of tenacity isnt even as strong as the current version nessacarily.

No, they don't apply to it.
The version in the OP only favors the person being hit by the cc.
--------------
It doesn't have a tradoff, it's just all around better o have tenacity and I'd even argue it's so good that it would completely remove the viability of buying any boots other than {{item:3111}} .
------------
This is especially the case for hard ccs like stuns since they remove the ability to cast from the affected champ, but in the OP they would have a large window to react and use their spells/items.  In one system that would be a sure pick on an enemy champ, but the above version turns it into a flash timer.
IF you don't understand why mine is the way it is then you lack the understanding to properly judge it. all of your argument is therefore false under the reasoning; lack of critical information.

?  I disagree therefore I can't judge?  What kind of reasoning is that?

Explain why yours is the way it is then, and why it's better.
Don' keep saying "it's just better."

Convince me please, since for it to be defended so fervently there must be something I'm missing in terms of counter-counterplay for the person applying the cc.

Explain it then.  Not the system itself (that's in the OP) but the gameplay health benefits from the PoV of the person who is applying the cc.

At least explain the gameplay reasoning for delayed hard cc vs immediate.
disagreeing is not your folley, not understanding is.
